main event: Multiple witnesses, including a deputy sheriff, reported a glowing, cigar-shaped object hovering and then disappearing in about three seconds over Bessemer, Birmingham, on September 27, 1950.
interesting points: The object had a luminous glow and appeared to be about the size of an auto tire, according to witnesses.
The U. S. Weather Bureau also received several calls describing the object as yellow or orange in color, gliding silently.
A cloud passing between the object and the steel mills blotted it out, ruling out the possibility of it being the mills.
The deputy sheriff stated that whatever it was, it scared him and was not any kind of airplane.
The object displayed unconventional behavior by hovering and then disappearing in a very short time period.
witnesses: Jefferson County deputy sheriff, multiple civilians
